resources.string: The Collatz conjecture is one of the most famous unsolved problem in mathematics. The conjecture asks whether repeating two simple arithmetic operations will eventually transform every positive integer into 1.

My task was to write a demo program showing how unpredictable the behavior of a sequence built using this rule. The two processes try different numbers before finding the hardest number 3x+1 (the one that gives the longest sequence on the way to 1). The top 10 such numbers are shown as circles of various sizes.
